p: Collectively, the studies showed the potential of Tagetes spp. as alternatives to a wide variety of drugs. The many alternative uses for Tagetes spp. resulted in the depletion of natural sources because its extracts and specific metabolites have such a high demand. Thus, the crop needs systematic cultivation in tropical, subtropical, and temperate agroclimatic zones worldwide [ 44, 45]. Marotti et al. [ 39] evidenced that most Tagetes spp. could be cultivated in environmental conditions different from those typical of the genus.
